  "title": "Subsea Cable Specialist",
  "description": "DNV&rsquo;s Renewables Certification (RC),&nbsp;We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.

As a trusted voice for many of the world&rsquo;s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Subsea Cable Specialist&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Job ID: 5602
Business: Energy Systems
Position type: Full Time
Contract type: Permanent Employee

Job Description


	We are seeking an engineer with a background in subsea cables (electrical or mechanical), to join our RC team in Taipei. RC has the global responsibility for Type Certification (TC), Component Certification (CC) and Project Certification (PC) within DNV Energy Systems. Currently, DNV RC consists of nearly 300 experts with locations in Boston, Busan, Hamburg, Copenhagen, Dresden, London, Shanghai, Beijing, Taipei and other cities.
	DNV is a market leader in Renewables Certification, and we work with the leading OEM&rsquo;s in the TC wind market and are involved in more than 80% of PC for offshore wind parks in the world.
	Offshore wind in Taiwan will continue to grow in order to meet the government&rsquo;s ambitious offshore wind targets &ndash; this will mean more fixed-bottom and eventually floating projects.
	To meet this demand, RC is expanding its team in the Taiwan and therefore seeks highly skilled and motivated persons to represent RC services in the rapidly growing offshore wind market.
	Overall responsibility of the position is to perform technical review work of the of the subsea power cables (and their interfaces to the wind turbine generators, offshore substation, and onshore termination) in collaboration with RC colleagues across our global organization.
	Technical review of subsea power cables considers the electrical, mechanical and interface designs, including manufacturing, transportation, and installation (with focus on CBRA, burial assessment studies, cable route design and secondary structures).
	Successful candidates may also perform onsite witnessing of fabrication, transportation, and installation work and/or serve as asset package or project managers for Taiwan offshore wind projects.


Responsibilities


	Delivering technical review in one or more of the certification work tasks related to the certification of subsea power cables
	Project/Package Manager for (one or more) Taiwan projects
	Coordination of work tasks and deliveries from other DNV units in Taiwan and abroad
	Participation in standards development, joint-industry-projects (JIPs) and conferences
	Follow-up with onsite witness of fabrication and transport &amp; installation activities in the Taiwan, Korea or other fabrication locations.
	Not only working on Taiwan projects, there are opportunities with international projects as well


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s or master&rsquo;s degree in relevant engineering background.
	Professional Engineer (P.E.) licensure is preferred.
	At least 4 years of engineering experience with preference towards subsea power cables, umbilicals, or similar. Understanding of Certification services and processes preferred.
	Knowledge of applicable standards and recommendations, e.g., IEC, IEEE, CIGRE, DNV, NFPA, NEMA, UL, etc., is required.
	Experience in managing projects or small teams is preferred.
	Highly professional and credible presence during interaction with customers and within DNV across all management levels
	Excellent networking skills. Ability to build and maintain relationships with colleagues and customers.
	Strong commercial attitude and strategic mind-set. Highly self-motivated and result oriented
	Well organized &amp; proactive, able to successfully work in a fast paced and competitive environment with diverse people &ndash; clients and co-workers
	Willingness and ability to travel
	Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.
	Good Chinese or Korean language skills a plus (both in writing and speaking).


Note:&nbsp;


	Security and compliance with statutory requirements in the countries in which we operate is essential for DNV.
	Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates as part of the offer process, in accordance with applicable country-specific laws and practices.

Subsea Cable Specialist Job at DNV’s Renewables Certification




        
    

        
        DNV’s Renewables Certification (RC), We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.

As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Subsea Cable Specialist 
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Nigeria
Job ID: 5602
Business: Energy Systems
Position type: Full Time
Contract type: Permanent Employee

Job Description


	We are seeking an engineer with a background in subsea cables (electrical or mechanical), to join our RC team in Taipei. RC has the global responsibility for Type Certification (TC), Component Certification (CC) and Project Certification (PC) within DNV Energy Systems. Currently, DNV RC consists of nearly 300 experts with locations in Boston, Busan, Hamburg, Copenhagen, Dresden, London, Shanghai, Beijing, Taipei and other cities.
	DNV is a market leader in Renewables Certification, and we work with the leading OEM’s in the TC wind market and are involved in more than 80% of PC for offshore wind parks in the world.
	Offshore wind in Taiwan will continue to grow in order to meet the government’s ambitious offshore wind targets – this will mean more fixed-bottom and eventually floating projects.
	To meet this demand, RC is expanding its team in the Taiwan and therefore seeks highly skilled and motivated persons to represent RC services in the rapidly growing offshore wind market.
	Overall responsibility of the position is to perform technical review work of the of the subsea power cables (and their interfaces to the wind turbine generators, offshore substation, and onshore termination) in collaboration with RC colleagues across our global organization.
	Technical review of subsea power cables considers the electrical, mechanical and interface designs, including manufacturing, transportation, and installation (with focus on CBRA, burial assessment studies, cable route design and secondary structures).
	Successful candidates may also perform onsite witnessing of fabrication, transportation, and installation work and/or serve as asset package or project managers for Taiwan offshore wind projects.


Responsibilities


	Delivering technical review in one or more of the certification work tasks related to the certification of subsea power cables
	Project/Package Manager for (one or more) Taiwan projects
	Coordination of work tasks and deliveries from other DNV units in Taiwan and abroad
	Participation in standards development, joint-industry-projects (JIPs) and conferences
	Follow-up with onsite witness of fabrication and transport & installation activities in the Taiwan, Korea or other fabrication locations.
	Not only working on Taiwan projects, there are opportunities with international projects as well


Requirements


	Bachelor’s or master’s degree in relevant engineering background.
	Professional Engineer (P.E.) licensure is preferred.
	At least 4 years of engineering experience with preference towards subsea power cables, umbilicals, or similar. Understanding of Certification services and processes preferred.
	Knowledge of applicable standards and recommendations, e.g., IEC, IEEE, CIGRE, DNV, NFPA, NEMA, UL, etc., is required.
	Experience in managing projects or small teams is preferred.
	Highly professional and credible presence during interaction with customers and within DNV across all management levels
	Excellent networking skills. Ability to build and maintain relationships with colleagues and customers.
	Strong commercial attitude and strategic mind-set. Highly self-motivated and result oriented
	Well organized & proactive, able to successfully work in a fast paced and competitive environment with diverse people – clients and co-workers
	Willingness and ability to travel
	Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.
	Good Chinese or Korean language skills a plus (both in writing and speaking).


Note: 


	Security and compliance with statutory requirements in the countries in which we operate is essential for DNV.
	Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates as part of the offer process, in accordance with applicable country-specific laws and practices.

Human Resources Officer Job at Owens and Xley Consults




        
    

        
        Owens and Xley Consults is a recruitment firm based in Lagos that offers business advisory and consulting services to help Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Officer

Job Locations: Lekki and Ikoyi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The HR Officer will support daily HR operations, including recruitment, onboarding, payroll support, employee relations, documentation, and compliance.
	The role requires strong organization skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work professionally with all departments.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist with staff recruitment, shortlisting, interviews, and onboarding.
	Maintain and update employee records, files, and HR databases.
	Support payroll preparation by gathering attendance, leave, and deduction details.
	Handle employee queries professionally and support positive staff relations.
	Monitor attendance, leave management, and policy compliance.
	Support performance reviews and probation evaluations.
	Prepare HR reports and ensure proper documentation and filing.
	Assist with HR policies, procedures, and compliance across branches.


Requirements


	Degree in HR, Business Admin, or a related field.
	1 – 2 years of HR experience.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong organization and documentation ability.
	Knowledge of HR processes and basic labor laws.
	Ability to work with minimal supervision.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@owensxley.com using “HR Officer" as subject of the mail.

        RSIN was founded in 2003 and is headquartered in Fuzhou, Fujian Province . we mainly conduct business in Nigeria and other western African countries. over the past 20 years of development, we have become a multinational corporation with diversified industrial clusters of iron and steel, chemical fibre, plastics, textile and lead-acid battery manufacturing based on the construction of circular economy industrial park.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement / Business Manager (Mining) 

Job Locations: Bauchi, Benue, Gombe, Nasarawa, Plateau
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Roles and Responsibilities

	Plans and designs mines, ensuring safety, efficiency, and commercial viability.
	Oversees day-to-day operations, manages teams, and ensures adherence to safety regulations.

	Operates machinery, designs entryways, and operates explosives to extract ore and rocks.
	Supports miners, performing various tasks to assist in the extraction of resources.
	Designs and implements mining projects, ensuring alignment with safety, environmental, and economic considerations.
	Collects and analyzes data, prepares sketches and notes, and verifies the accuracy of survey information.
	Ability to solve problem, think of a better way to outsource for materials for company


Skills and Experience


	Technical Skills: Proficiency in mining-related computer software, understanding of mining operations and processes, ability to develop and implement advanced mining techniques.
	Analytical Skills: Ability to analyze data, identify optimal mining locations and methods, and prepare reports on production metrics.
	Management Skills: Leadership, team management, project management, and the ability to train and mentor staff.
	Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication, ability to present information effectively, and collaborate with various teams.
	Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to identify and resolve issues, troubleshoot complex problems, and adapt to changing circumstances.

Experience:


	Prior experience in the mining industry, particularly in roles related to the specific job function.
